properties.Name: ProductIndirectLaborBudget
properties.Description:
Labor costs that cannot be specifically linked to delivery, sales or support of specific products, but which are necessary for producing those products.   

Sales, marketing and support services are examples.

Indirect labor costs are a part of "overhead costs" on the income statement, which, in turn is part of 'cost of goods sold' (CGS) or 'cost of services provided'.

As a component of CGS, the higher indirect labor costs, the lower the gross margin (and income as well).

Columns.Name: ProductIndirectLaborBudgetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product Indirect Labor Budget.

Columns.Name: ProductIndirectLaborBudgetVersionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product Indirect Labor Budget Version.

Columns.Name: ProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: OperatingBudgetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product/Service Operating Budget.

Columns.Name: OperatingBudgetVersionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Operating Budget Version.

Columns.Name: BudgetedNumberOfDirectLaborEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of indirect employees forecast for the period to directly support the associated product/service.

Columns.Name: BudgetedDirectLaborEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden indirect labor employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: BudgetedNumberOfDirectLaborNonEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of indirect non-employees forecast for the period to directly support the associated product/service.

Columns.Name: BudgetedDirectLaborNonEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden indirect labor non-employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: ActualNumberOfDirectLaborEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The actual number of indirect employees required for the period to directly support the associated product/service.

Columns.Name: ActualNumberOfDirectLaborNonEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The actual number of indirect non-employees required for the period to directly support the associated product/service.

Columns.Name: ActualDirectLaborFullyBurdenedEmployeeLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The actual fully-burden indirect labor costs for employees for the period.

Columns.Name: ActualDirectLaborNonEmployeeLaborsCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The actual fully-burden indirect labor costs for non-employees for the period.

Properties.Description:
Labor costs that cannot be specifically linked to delivery, sales or support of specific products, but which are necessary for producing those products.   

Sales, marketing and support services are examples.

Indirect labor costs are a part of "overhead costs" on the income statement, which, in turn is part of 'cost of goods sold' (CGS) or 'cost of services provided'.

As a component of CGS, the higher indirect labor costs, the lower the gross margin (and income as well).
